oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Program cover with scene from the battle of New Orleans
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A sketch drawing that depicts Andrew Jackson and other soldiers fighting at the Battle of New Orleans during the War of 1812.

During the War of 1812, Major-General Andrew Jackson commanded militia in several battles. Jackson's overwhelming success at the Battle of New Orleans (January 8, 1815) brought him to national attention. His fame eventually led to his rise in political office and he was elected as president of the United States in 1828. He was reelected in 1832.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, --1767 - 1845; New Orleans, Battle of, New Orleans, La., 1815
Photographs
